lines: The folk you meet here may seem boorishly provincial, but do try to show them some mercy. Had you been driven from your home and forced to wallow in disease and poverty, I doubt you'd fare much better.
What little we have in this world was bought with our blood. Humble as this place may be, it's ours, and I've grown to treasure it.
And so, much as I'd like to take the fight to the Garleans, a greater part of me wants to stay here and keep these people safe.
Everyone here has been on edge of late. No one's quite sure just what is going on in Gyr Abania.

I've decided not to make the move. It's been so long since we first arrived here it feels more like home than Ala Mhigo ever could. What's more, should Ala Mhigo want to trade more with Ul'dah, they'll need someone to act as an intermediary.
